moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 N: A garden-variety Sicilian to this point.
moves.9. Qd2 Bd7: Noteboom continues to quietly build his position.
moves.10. f4 a6: Keeping Thompson's pieces out of QN5.
moves.11. Nf3 b5: Countering the K-side push of White with a Q-side space grab.
moves.14. O-O-O b4: White "castled into it", and Noteboom takes immediate advantage.
moves.16. Qe2 Rxc3: A sharp sacrifice to rip open the defenses on the Q-side.
moves.17. bxc3 Na2+: Forcing his way to the helpless White King.
moves.18. Kd2 Nxe4+: Not only pressing the attack but clearing the long diagonal.
moves.19. Ke1 Naxc3: Continuing the chase and forking two major pieces.
moves.22. Bxa6 Qa5: Bringing the Q into play with tempo.
moves.27. Kg2 Rc8: Thompson mercifully elects to "aufgegeben" rather than prolong the inevitable. A beautiful attack by Noteboom!
